text: it was a cloudy and overcast morning at UK's research and education center which made for comfortable temperatures not usually the case for July in Western Kentucky but welcomed by the crop scouting teams the eight high school teams consisting of four to six members rotated through ten stations in the competition ranging from soil properties weeds corn agronomics and more in a very hands-on event so insects disease we're teaching them how to scout fields work with some of our soil issues and also some basic corn soybean agronomics as well because there is a younger grouse stage do you think that Kirsten why said the competition is very similar to what a professional crop scout or consultant would do in their job and gives UK a chance to showcase its facilities we think this is a great opportunity for the University of Kentucky to interact with high school students particularly students that are interested in agriculture of course I did some scouting when I was back in high school in college Bobby Schmitt was taught agriculture at Livingston County for 25 years was excited about the opportunity to bring his students to the competition and be so close to home I've been over here several times for field days and stuff and if nobody's ever been here it's really a neat place because you see so much on relatively a small acreage I think it's a good good representation of West Kentucky are the soils that we have and a lot of growing conditions you mentioned some of the insects Schmidt liked the fact that contest involved UK specialists guiding the students through the stations UK faculty graduate students and interns all were involved in the competition and the students in the contest said they learned a lot going in like staging corn and like which sage it comes in and like I learned the same with like soybeans I got to learn like where you look at the plant like which node you need to look at and different stuff like that so that was pretty cool I believe it will give me foresight for the future to kind of see what I'd be getting into like taking that college courses saying well hey you know this is kind of what this is about you know give me just a little bit of information before you dive deep into that big terminology officials at UK's research and education center hope to make the competition an annual event from the University of Kentucky College of Agriculture Food and environmental reporting [Music]
